controller

Class Darwini

  • java.lang.Object
    • robocode._RobotBase
      • robocode._Robot

                  • controller.Darwini
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, robocode.robotinterfaces.IAdvancedEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IAdvancedRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents2, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents3, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IInteractiveEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IInteractiveRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IPaintEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IPaintRobot

    public class Darwini
extends InitialRobot

    A robot based on an existing one, however this one will improve itself over time, by building and following a neural network. Must extend an operational robot extending AdvancedRobot

    Version:
    1.0 - 17/11/15
    Author:
    BOIZUMAULT Romain, BUSSENEAU Alexis, GEFFRAULT Luc, MATHIEU Vianney, VAILLAND Guillaume

      private AcquisitionData acquisitionData
      The object "AcquisitionData" Thanks to this object, we will be able to collect the environment data of the robot (used as entries in the perceptron) every turn.

      The OutputData "decisions" This object collect all the perceptron output data which and allowed us to get them more simply throw gets methods
      private NeuralNetwork perceptron
      The perceptron "neuralNetworkShoot" This is the perceptron used in the Darwini's decision process.
      static java.lang.String PERCEPTRON_FILE
      The NeuralNetwork xml file The file which contains the perceptron's weighting coefficients that our Darwini robot will use.

    • Field Detail

      • PERCEPTRON_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String PERCEPTRON_FILE
        The NeuralNetwork xml file

        The file which contains the perceptron's weighting coefficients that our Darwini robot will use. This file is charged during the perceptron creation

        See Also:
        NeuralNetwork, run(), Constant Field Values

      • acquisitionData

        private AcquisitionData acquisitionData
        The object "AcquisitionData"

        Thanks to this object, we will be able to collect the environment data of the robot (used as entries in the perceptron) every turn.

        This object is initialized in Darwini's run function and called every time Darwini has to make a decision (Every time it scans an enemy)

        See Also:
        AcquisitionData, run(), onScannedRobot(ScannedRobotEvent)

      • perceptron

        private NeuralNetwork perceptron
        The perceptron "neuralNetworkShoot"

        This is the perceptron used in the Darwini's decision process.

        See Also:
        NeuralNetwork, run(), onScannedRobot(ScannedRobotEvent)

      • decisions

        private OutputData decisions
        The OutputData "decisions"

        This object collect all the perceptron output data which and allowed us to get them more simply throw gets methods

        See Also:
        OutputData, onScannedRobot(ScannedRobotEvent)

      • Darwini

        public Darwini()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The run methods

        We initialized the Darwini's perceptron which will take all decisions and the object acquisitionData which will be collecting, every turns, the environment data needed in the decision process.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class InitialRobot
        See Also:
        perceptron, acquisitionData, PERCEPTRON_FILE

      • onScannedRobot

        public void onScannedRobot(robocode.ScannedRobotEvent e)
        The reaction of Darwini when it has scanned an enemy

        We load the environment data (thanks to acquisitionData) in the Darwini's perceptron and collect the different perceptron decisions to act

        Specified by:
        onScannedRobot in interface robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents
        Overrides:
        onScannedRobot in class InitialRobot
        Parameters:
        e - the scanned robot
        See Also:
        acquisitionData, decisions, perceptron

        private double sigmoid(double i)

        Apply the sigmoid on the specified value.

        Parameters:
        i - the value to apply the sigmoid
        Returns:
        the value after the sigmoid computation
